title: Kasaï : impayés, les agents de la DGRKAS centre rural d'Ilebo réclament cinq mois d'arriérés de salaire
text:
Provinces
Les agents de la Direction générale des recettes du Kasaï (DGRKAS) à Ilebo sont en colère en raison du non-paiement de leurs salaires.
Ils réclament cinq mois d'arriérés et disent ne pas comprendre pourquoi ils ne sont toujours pas payés. En signe de protestation, ils ont fermé tous les bureaux de service, empêchant tout accès aux locaux ce jeudi 27 mars 2025.
"Nous regrettons cette mauvaise gestion de la Direction générale, qui fonctionne de manière opaque. Nous réclamons le paiement de nos cinq mois d’arriérés de salaire, comme promis par le ministre provincial des Finances, accompagné du Directeur général adjoint technique et d’une équipe du gouvernorat", déclarent les agents.
Ces derniers dénoncent également une confusion dans la gestion des fonds : "Pour l’instant, l’argent est versé chez Soficom, mais nous ne savons pas comment nous allons être payés. Le centre verse l’argent à la banque, puis le guichet unique le transfère à Soficom. C’est une situation totalement floue".
En réaction, la direction générale de la DGRKAS appelle au calme et promet de trouver une solution dans les prochains jours. Le Directeur général adjoint, Dieumerci Ngwabitshi, reconnaît la situation mais parle de quatre mois d'arriérés au lieu de cinq. Il assure que le problème sera résolu sous peu.

author: Marlyn Montilla
title: Israel celebra la apertura de un corredor marítimo humanitario a Gaza por parte de la Unión Europea y Estados Unidos - El Diario NY
text: Israel celebra la apertura de un corredor marítimo humanitario a Gaza por parte de la Unión Europea y Estados Unidos Según Israel, la iniciativa de Chipre permitirá incrementar la ayuda humanitaria a Gaza, tras los controles de seguridad pertinentes, además, Ursula Von der Leyen, dijo que el corredor marítimo empezaría el sábado o el domingo Israel recibió este viernes “con satisfacción” el anuncio que durante el fin de semana se inaugurará un corredor marítimo humanitario desde Chipe a la Franja de Gaza, iniciativa que viene por parte de la Unión Europea (UE) y Estados Unidos. “La iniciativa chipriota permitirá aumentar la ayuda humanitaria a la Franja de Gaza, después de que se realicen controles de seguridad de acuerdo con los estándares israelíes“, afirmó Lior Haiat, representante del Ministerio de Exteriores de Israel, país que mantiene cerradas las vías de acceso terrestre al enclave. Actualmente, Israel permite, tras controles específicos, la entrada de ayuda humanitaria a través del cruce de Kerem Shalom, que conecta Gaza e Israel, con una media de unos 250 camiones diarios en la última semana (antes rondaban los cien) una cifra muy baja para las enormes necesidades de la Franja. “Israel seguirá facilitando la transferencia de ayuda humanitaria a los residentes de la Franja de Gaza de acuerdo con las reglas de la guerra y en coordinación con Estados Unidos y nuestros aliados en todo el mundo”, afirmó el ministerio. Por su parte, la presidenta de la Comisión Europea, Ursula Von der Leyen, anunció este viernes que el corredor marítimo con la ayuda para Gaza iniciará sus funciones este sábado o domingo, aunque habrá un primer viaje piloto saliendo de Chipre este mismo viernes. “Estamos muy cerca de la apertura del corredor, esperemos que este sábado, este domingo, y me alegra mucho ver que hoy se pondrá en marcha una primera operación piloto”, dijo la líder comunitaria en una rueda de prensa en Larnaca (Chipre) junto con el presidente chipriota, Nikos Jristodoulidis. Asimismo, el presidente Joe Biden anunció el jueves la construcción de un puerto temporal frente a las costas de Gaza para facilitar la entrada de la ayuda humanitaria y controlar desde allí la que se flete desde Chipre por vía marítima. “Es muy importante que más países se unan a la iniciativa chipriota y al esfuerzo internacional para transferir ayuda”, afirmó el vocero israelí de Exteriores, que destacó la intención de Israel de seguir con la guerra hasta que se cumplan todos sus objetivos: destruir a Hamás y traer de vuelta a los rehenes. En las últimas semanas, la comunidad internacional, particularmente Estados Unidos, está presionando a Israel para que facilite la entrada de ayuda humanitaria a la Franja, donde la hambruna ha dejado varios fallecidos en el norte, ya que es Israel quien supervisa todo lo que entra, igualmente lo que pasa por el cruce de Rafah con Egipto. author: Gina Sirico
title: NatGeo and David Attenborough join forces for new documentary on the world's oceans - ABC13 Houston
text: The documentary, currently titled 'David Attenborough: Ocean" will premiere in 2025 WASHINGTON, D.C. -- How healthy are our world's oceans? National Geographic and renowned natural historian David Attenborough are teaming up to produce a feature-length documentary to look at just that. Currently titled "David Attenborough: Oceans," the documentary will take a closer look at our interconnected waters and what we all can do to keep them healthy. It's the first time the two have partnered for a project. In a statement, Attenborough said, "My lifetime has coincided with the great age of ocean discovery. Over the last hundred years, scientists and explorers have revealed remarkable new species, epic migrations and dazzling, complex ecosystems beyond anything I could have imagined as a young man. In this film, we share those wonderful discoveries, uncover why our ocean is in such poor health, and, perhaps most importantly, show how it can bounce back to life." Tom McDonald, National Geographic's executive vice president of Global Factual and Unscripted Content, had this to say about working with Attenborough, "There is no one better to deliver this landmark film than Sir David. I have had the privilege and pleasure of working with him many times over the past decade, and so I am, of course, personally and professionally thrilled that he has agreed to work with National Geographic for the very first time on a subject that is timely and close to his heart." "David Attenborough: Oceans" will premiere in 2025 in theaters, then will air on National Geographic and stream on Disney+ and Hulu. The Walt Disney Company is the parent company of National Geographic, Disney+, Hulu and this ABC station.

author: Mark Jackson
title: Starlink Broadband Scraps Free UK Pause Mode for Paid Standby Mode
text:
SpaceX’s Starlink service, which sells ultrafast broadband to the UK and globally via masses of compact satellites in Low Earth Orbit (LEO), has done what some might consider a bit of a ‘bait-and-switch’ by suddenly replacing their ‘Pause Mode‘ (i.e. allowing you to stop and restart the service at no extra cost) with a new ‘Standby Mode‘ that costs £4.50 per month.
The Starlink service currently has around 8,100 satellites in orbit (c.4,500 are v2 / V2 Mini) – mostly at altitudes of c.500-600km – and they’ll add thousands more by the end of 2027. Residential customers in the UK usually pay from £75 a month ($120 in the USA), plus £299 for hardware (currently free for most areas) on the ‘Standard’ unlimited data plan (kit price may vary due to different offers), which promises UK latency times of 28-36ms, downloads of 103-258Mbps and uploads of 15-26Mbps. Cheaper and more restrictive options also exist for roaming users.
One of the most useful features on this service was Pause Mode, which until now had allowed customers to stop the service (inc. monthly payments) anytime they wanted and then restart it once needed again (handy when using Starlink as a backup or for periodic roaming / travel etc.). But customers on their Roam, Residential and Priority plans in the UK (inc. some other countries) have now been informed of an “upgrade” that sees Pause Mode being replaced by Standby Mode.
Advertisement
In Standby Mode customers will remain connected to the service at a significantly reduced speed (seemingly 0.5Mbps) for unlimited data, albeit now at a cost of £4.50 per month. The move will no doubt annoy some people and the modern internet is extremely difficult to use at such a connection speed, although some people may find it useful for getting basic tasks done (it could also be seen as a really cheap backup plan). But all the same, it would have worked better as an extra option, rather than an enforced replacement. Credits to forum member Stewart for the screenshot below.
However, while Pause Mode might have just been unceremoniously jettisoned in the name of more £££ for SpaceX and Elon, it’s worth noting that there is still a way to get a similar benefit. The FAQ page states: “If pausing with Standby Mode does not meet your needs, you are able to cancel at no cost and restart service on an available plan whenever you’re ready.” The catch is that this approach does come with some added checks (friction), but that may be worth it to avoid the £4.50 monthly charge for a service you’re not using.

title: Kim Jong Un Directs North Korean Military to Speed Up War Readiness
text:
Kim Jong Un Directs North Korean Military to Speed Up War Readiness
[World](articles/category/30/World)| December 28, 2023, Thursday // 13:00
North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has recently issued orders to the country's military, emphasizing the need to expedite war preparations in response to what he perceives as increasingly hostile actions by the United States. The instruction came during a meeting of North Korea's ruling Workers' Party, where Kim Jong Un outlined tasks for the People's Army, munitions industry, nuclear weapons, and civil defense sectors, emphasizing the acceleration of readiness for potential conflict. This directive, reported by the official Korean Central News Agency (KCNA), follows Kim Jong Un's portrayal of the 'military situation' on the Korean peninsula as 'extreme' due to what he deemed 'unprecedented' confrontations between North Korea and the US.
While specific details about these preparations were not detailed in the state news agency's report, tensions have been mounting. South Korea, Japan, and the United States have strengthened political and defense ties in response to North Korea's significant series of weapons tests. They have also initiated a system to share real-time data concerning North Korean missile launches. Moreover, the recent arrival of a US nuclear-powered submarine in South Korea and the joint drills involving long-range bombers alongside Seoul and Tokyo underscore heightened concerns.
Simultaneously, North Korea has made considerable advancements in its military capabilities. It recently succeeded in launching its first military spy satellite, overcame technical challenges with the Hwasong-18, its most advanced intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM), and solidified its nuclear status in the country's constitution.
Diplomatic talks between North Korea and the US collapsed in 2019 following unsuccessful high-stakes summits aimed at negotiating sanctions relief against Pyongyang's nuclear program. The UN Security Council has imposed sanctions on North Korea since its inaugural nuclear test in 2006.
Amidst this escalation, North Korea's burgeoning relations with Moscow have attracted attention. Kim Jong Un's visit to Russia in September, which included visits to military bases and weapons factories, fueled speculations of potential military exchanges between the two countries. These speculations intensified amidst concerns that North Korea might provide Moscow with military technology in exchange for support in its conflict with Ukraine. As tensions rise and alliances shift, the global geopolitical landscape remains in a state of heightened alertness over North Korea's strategic maneuvers.

title: "More has been killed in the name of God than in the name of anything else" - timenews
text: 2023-12-24 17:28:51 No one in Catalonia knows as much about Islam as she does. Nor does anyone explain it with their knowledge, passion and vehemence. It looks like he’s scolding you, but he’s not. If this piece of woman scolded you, don’t worry that you would notice. Dolors Bramon (Banyoles, 1943) is the religion teacher we should all have had. This year he received the Cross of Sant Jordi and published Professor of Islam (Fragmenta Editorial), a book-conversation with Ignasi Moreta. In this interview we talk about God and the different ways of understanding him, but we also go to Carrero Blanco or Ernest Lluch, her first husband. When was the last time you asked God for something? — I’ve never asked him for anything, I’m used to freaking out. My grandfather was very renegade and one day I asked God to convert him, but I must have been six or seven years old. I haven’t spent much, by God, but I’ve earned my living thanks to God, in both senses of the word. What is the latest explanation you have found for why so many people believe in God? — There are people who need support. In life there are problems, and if you have the consolation of religion it goes very well. If you don’t have it, if you can’t ask God for anything, you should freak out. And you usually end up getting away with it, huh? It’s not that essential either, I think. I don’t think you have to be a good person because there is a superior being. You have to be a good person for your personal dignity. I haven’t needed God, but there are people who do and I think that’s fine, I have nothing against believers. Do you think you’ll need it, God? There are people who may never have believed and in the last years of their lives they are looking for something. — Heh, heh, forgive me for laughing. It’s just that sometimes I think: “Let’s see if in the end you’ll end up believing in God”. No, I never said that God did not exist. It is a pride to say that it exists and it is also a pride to say that it does not exist. what do i know I’m agnostic, I don’t know if there is a God or not. If there is, I haven’t needed it for now. If there isn’t, neither. But are you afraid that you might be needed one day? – No, I’m afraid not. makes me laugh What is the difference between the three monotheistic religions: Christianity, Judaism, and Islam? — Much less what their practitioners do not want to think and believe. All three groups have spent their lives looking for more differences than similarities. And in this they were wrong. all All three come from the same God. There is some small difference. For example, Judaism does not believe in the Virgin Mary. Islam, yes. Jesus is a great prophet son of a virgin mother. And it makes sense: an almighty God can cause a virgin mother to give birth to a child or to twenty-eight. Therefore, Allah… — It’s the Arabic way of saying Ten. …is not another. — Of course not. Now, if we were in class, you would already have a suspension. Therefore, there is only one God and both Jesus, on the one hand, and Muhammad, on the other, would be prophets? — No, because for Christians Jesus is God. This is the mess that Jesus is the second person of the Holy Trinity. They took great care to tell us Taradell and Banyoles people, when we were small, that this was a mystery and that you should not try to understand it, because it cannot be understood. If there is a God, there can only be one. And the Qur’an says this very clearly: God is a superior, eternal and creative being. If there were more than one god, each of those gods would claim what he had created. And I’m not interested in the god who created AIDS or earthquakes. I am interested in the god who created good things. READ Also: "Los Chapitos are not a criminal group," a lawyer denied that they belong to the Sinaloa Cartel It will be fatal for me to say it, but I was happy the day ETA killed Carrero Blanco” Then we will return to religion. You have explained many times where Ernest Lluch, your first husband, took you the first day you went out together… — Oh, yes. Al Price, let’s watch a boxing match: Ben Ali vs. Vetroff. And I didn’t dislike it. But I never went back. You separated in 1984 and he was killed in 2000. Do you remember the last time you saw each other before his death? — I don’t remember, we used to see each other, we had three daughters together. What has not been explained and may be of interest is that the three daughters and I were very healthy when he was killed. It was murder. So you are left with white, green and yellow. We set up, without realizing it, a kind of competition because you can’t imagine the number of people who had dinner with Ernest the night before he was killed. The girls said: “He filled the Barça field. Everyone had dinner with him.” And I arrived, who had been to Ethiopia, and I said: “Girls, I beat you, I met the last person who saw the old people when they left the parking lot.” This was already insurmountable. We took it very badly, but very well. A lot of people have had their father die, it’s worse murder, okay, but it’s something you can deal with. They had a hard time when they went to the doctor, for example, and were asked: “What illnesses have you had? What did the father die of?” And they had to say: “Murder”. Look, today [l’entrevista la fem el dimecres 20 de desembre] 50 years ago ETA killed Carrero Blanco. I was glad about that, I must confess. It will be fatal for me to say it. Notice, between ETA killing Carrero Blanco and you being happy about it, and ETA killing Ernest Lluch, just over 25 years pass. — Yes, yes, things had changed. We didn’t see it as murder, but almost as a good deed. We didn’t know that Arias Navarro would be worse. You, as the mother of Ernest Lluch’s daughters, as his first wife, do you also consider yourself in some way a victim of ETA? — Man, clear. It was a blow to many people. If you die, and in this way, it is immediately holy right away. That is true, but I will say no more. That Ernest was made a saint on the spot, you mean. — Right away. And everyone And it can’t be to everyone’s liking. We never please everyone. In this case, ETA was killing for some ideas. But in the name of God a lot has been killed. — Much more than on behalf of anyone. All groups of believers have killed more in the name of God than in the name of anything else. And why? — Because humanity is a beast and if you think you have the truth… You asked me about these three ways of understanding God. I don’t usually talk about religions, but about ways of understanding God. There is a God, if there is one, and everyone understands him in their own way. The problem with people who think that there is only one God – and that it is theirs – is that they always believe that they have the truth and that they can kill in the name of that truth. Lately, we have the tendency – I would say biased, you will confirm it – that in the name of God only Islam kills. – Nooo. It is a big mistake made by some who call themselves Muslims. Why this shouting “Al·lahu-àkbar” at the time of killing is an aberration, because God forbids you to kill. This does a lot of harm to Islam and not all Muslims, far from it, agree with it. I meant that historically all religions have killed. – All. Man, European Catholics, especially Hispanics, have a very checkered past. If you think about the Inquisition, I don’t need to tell you anything. We can’t brag about it. Do you know what happens? That now these three religions are going to the right. There is no one to stop this, they all go towards conservatism. But Catholics now have a more progressive Pope, don’t they? The latest he has done is to say that the Church will bless homosexual unions. — Yes, exactly, now you said it: bless. And if they want to get married? What if your sister wants to be a chaplain? Huh? Everything goes to the right. Let’s see, when the popes speak from the throne, that is to say, inspired by the Holy Spirit, I think: “This Holy Spirit is a bit strange, because John XXIII was inspired by certain things, Ratzinger by others and the present one by others”. This papa has been opened. Wait for the next one. The Curia is a lot of Curia and Rome is a lot of Rome. I’m listening to you and I think what a shame I didn’t have a teacher like you, a non-believer, who explained religions to me. — It has nothing to do with it. Precisely if you don’t believe in anything, you have more capacity for reasoning. Whenever he started a course, he told them: “Faith is outside the classroom. I’m not interested in what religious thought you have, nor should you be interested in whether I have one or not.” That was not a catechesis. Seen this way, chaplains should not teach religion. — They shouldn’t, no. It’s just that now maybe I’m getting ahead of a question you’ll ask me later, which is whether religion should be taught in schools. I would be in favor of a person like me teaching all religions. How do you want to understand a Romanesque capital? Or Verdaguer? Or Carner? Or Spirit? Now that you have said Espriu, do you think that lately Catalonia’s admiration for Israel has disappeared? — Notice, the first trip that President Pujol made abroad was to Israel. In an Islamic country it may have taken fifteen years to get there. He went to Tunisia. We Catalans have had a predilection for Israel, largely thanks to Franco’s mora guard, who entered many towns and did a lot of damage. Espriu also contributed: the persecuted people, the persecuted language… This began to change with Ariel Sharon and the brutality of Sabra and Xatila. In this latest war between Israel and Hamas, who do you go with? I’m telling you because you can’t seem to follow what’s going on without going with one or the other. — I can’t go with anyone, but I’ll tell you something. The idea is from Salah Jamal, a lovely person, a Palestinian who has been here for many years. One day he said: “Imagine that you are going to see a film of thewest and he arrives late, and when he arrives, the screen shows an apache pulling a white man’s hair. What will you think? That the Apaches are… But you arrived late to the film”. With that, everything is said. The best thing that has happened to you this past year is that you were given the St George’s Cross? — I was excited. a lot I’m curious to know who did me good to be given it. Isn’t that what they say in your town? Yes, and that’s all it says. Dolors, when was the last time you bit your tongue? — Now, here with you, ha ha ha. No, I’ve always said what I thought. I would say always. And that’s how it went for me. I’ve had difficulties here at university, for example, but I’ve come out of it. You know what I like the most? When I meet ex-students on the street and they say: “You taught me how to think”. More than one has told me. It’s nice to have been taught to think. Since I have not believed in any religion, I have spoken calmly and rigorously about them all. And the worst news of this last year is that you will turn 80 on December 31st? — Oh, no, I love getting old. Neither round nor square numbers. What I want is to find myself well. Look, good news from last year. They did a biopsy to find out if I had cancer and I was in Madrid doing a master’s degree and they called me in the middle of class. I picked up the phone and said, from the podium: “I don’t have cancer!” And they applauded me. The last two questions are the same for everyone. Could you tell me a song from El Último de la Fila? — I can’t tell you a song, but I know them. Now they are out of fashion… Ask me about The Tyets, but not El Último de la Fila. The last words in this interview are yours. — Thank you very much, I must tell you. Because sometimes you meet people who ask you questions that you don’t know what to say. And you haven’t done any of these to me. A conversation in the same classroom where he studied We recorded the interview with Dolors Bramon in room 113 of the University of Barcelona, the same class where she studied the first course of economics in 1961. She walks around, looks at her, observes what has changed and what she is the same, and ends up regretting that she is left. Francesc Melcion’s photo session represents torture for him. It hasn’t started yet and I wish it was over. What Dolors likes is talking, “what I’ve done all my life: preach”. When the conversation ends, he runs off to catch the “bus”, the Teisa bus, towards Banyoles. An hour and a quarter that will be used to read or to sleep. “When I arrive, I have to buy for these days, you see the shops and it seems that in Banyoles people only eat at Christmas”. Albert Om is a journalist #killed #God

title: Chaos at Punjab Power Corp: Employees extend strike until Sep 17 as locals outrage over 20+ hours of power outage
text:
Residents of Harmilap Nagar Phases I and II, Saini Vihar, Gurjivan Vihar, and several others protested outside PSPCL’s power grid in Dhakoli, Punjab on Thursday, 12th September after suffering from electricity power cut since 10 pm on Monday.
The enraged public raised chants against the PSPCL and the Punjab government, stating that there was no power in a dozen housing societies from Monday night (10 pm) until Tuesday evening (7 pm). PSPCL officials had to call the police to deal with the furious people, which included children and women.
For the majority of the day, the supply of electricity in Baltana remained inconsistent. Surinder Singh Bains, Executive Engineer at Zirakpur PSPCL, stated that “many employees were on strike, which affected supply.” Rains additionally served as an intrusion.
PSPCL executives stated that a mass exodus by various union members of the PSPCL exacerbated the matter. Many PSPCl employees went on strike today, taking mass leave from various Mohali office locations. Residents of Badhmajra also reported experiencing lengthy power outages.
Major decisions to escalate the ongoing struggle were made during a meeting chaired by Ratan Singh Majari and Gurpreet Singh Gandiwind, both convenors of the PSEB Employees Joint Forum, Electricity Employees Ekta Manch Punjab, and the Association of Junior Engineers. The two convenors and the state president of the association, Ranjit Singh Dhillon, attended a state-level press conference in Ludhiana to provide information about the meeting in Chandigarh, which was called by the electricity minister.
Addressing a press conference, Ranjit Singh Dhillon, provincial leaders Additional SDO Raghveer Singh, Rachpal Singh Pali, and Kewal Singh Banvait of Panserj Union demanded the proper management of the state electricity board employees. He said that the grid of unauthorized officials instilled fear and uncertainty in the electricity workers as the former allegedly carried out unlawful actions.
Given this, union representatives have decided to extend the collective break from September 13th to September 17th (5 days), and all power workers will demonstrate in front of the board headquarters. As per the reports, the next action will be declared on September 17th, with a state-level demonstration in front of the headquarters in Patiala.
During the protest, black flags will be exhibited to the power corporation’s management, including the power minister. He further stated that, after the farmers’ unions, they have additionally received the support of the Patwar Union.
Ranjit Singh Dhillon, provincial leader Additional SDO Raghveer Singh and Rachpal Singh Pali further apologized for the inconvenience caused to the people and urged them to cooperate in their action against the Punjab government, the power minister and the management of the electricity corporation.

author: Lauren Brennecke
title: Tornado recovery funding plan St. Louis
text:
ST. LOUIS–Mayor Cara Spencer announced a $19.2 million spending plan aimed at helping residents recover from the May 16 tornado. The plan includes money for home repairs, temporary housing and rent assistance, mental health services and funding for resource hubs.
The funding package includes $18 million from interest accumulated from the Rams settlement fund and $1.2 million from Community Development Block Grant funds. The funds are divided across several areas aimed to address immediate and emerging recovery needs.
“Our plan allows us to spend these funds where the need is greatest and in ways that won't overlap with what our partners at FEMA and at the state level are doing,” Spencer said. “This is just the start as we build a long-term plan.”
Funds will provide: $2.5 million for resource hubs (including meals, supplies)
$2.2 million for unmet needs (storage, rental assistance, temporary housing)
$5 million for home repairs for un/underinsured
$3.5 million for case management, mental health, and legal services.
$1 million to provide cooling through water stations and water sprinklers.
Up to $5 million for non-profit support
The mayor also announced a new Tornado Recovery Office to coordinate long-term rebuilding efforts. It will be based in the mayor’s office and led by Julian Nicks, previous interim deputy chief operating officer.
“The priorities we envision include supporting impacted residents, ensuring they stabilize their lives, stay in St. Louis and recover,” Spencer said. “This office will also lead our community engagement efforts to shape our recovery vision and refine our priorities.”
Residents can also expect new debris removal efforts starting next week. Utility trucks will begin in North St. Louis, moving south through a grid-based approach. Residents should still leave debris on curbs for collection.
Mayor Spencer says environmental inspectors will visually assess debris piles and separate asbestos and potentially hazardous materials for disposal. Hauling monitors will be stationed at intersections to document and catalogue debris removal to maximize FEMA reimbursement potential.
“Debris removal is going to be an enormous undertaking and enormously expensive,” Spencer said. “We expect this phase to last between 4 and 6 weeks, but we do intend to have a long term third phase ready to go before the end of this.”
The proposal is expected to go before the City’s Board of Estimate and Apportionment at a special meeting next week. If approved, city officials say the funding will be distributed and programs implemented next month.
